intro: Urostachys erythraeus, commonly known as the red sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial that typically reaches a height of 10–30 cm. The plant features fleshy, succulent leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of red, pink, or white. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Urostachys erythraeus is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
